DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : Laparoscopic staging may help doctor plan effective treatment ovarian , primary fallopian tube , primary abdominal cancer . DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : I . Determine feasibility laparoscopic stag patient incompletely stag ovarian , primary fallopian tube , primary peritoneal cancer . II . Assess adverse effect associate technique . OUTLINE : Surgery . Laparoscopy cytologic examination lymph node sample follow , feasible , surgical resection . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : Up 50 patient accrue approximately 2 year . If 4 evaluable patient complete surgery , study close .
DOC.criteria: DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS : One follow incompletely stag malignancy : Ovarian cancer cell type Primary fallopian tube carcinoma Primary peritoneal carcinoma No clinical evidence metastasis abdominal organ , adnexa , retroperitoneal lymph node CT contrast prior abdominal surgery No metastases chest xray No contraindication laparoscopy , i.e . : No bowel obstruction No ileus No peritonitis No excessive obesity indicate Quetelet Index 35 ( weight kg/height sqm ) No diaphragmatic hernia chest xray No grade 2 heart toxicity PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS : Age : Adult Performance status : GOG 0 1 Hematopoietic : WBC least 3,000/mm3 Platelet count least 100,000/mm3 Hepatic : Bilirubin 1.5 mg/dL AST 3 time normal Renal : Creatinine 2.0 mg/dL Other : No second malignancy except nonmelanomatous skin cancer Not pregnant PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY : Biologic therapy : Not specify Chemotherapy : No prior concomitant chemotherapy Endocrine therapy : Not specify Radiotherapy : No prior concomitant abdominal pelvic radiotherapy Surgery : No prior retroperitoneal surgery No 10 week since initial abdominal surgery
